title: Continuance of the Federal Emergency Management Agency Review Council
summary: This executive order, issued by the President, continues the Federal Emergency Management Agency Review Council, a Federal Advisory Committee established to provide advice on FEMA programs and policies related to emergency management. It authorizes the Council to operate under the Federal Advisory Committee Act (5 U.S.C. chapter 10) and sets its purpose to review FEMA initiatives, readiness and response policies, and to furnish recommendations to the President and FEMA Administrator. The order directs federal agencies to provide staff and resources to support the Council, and establishes guidance on its duration and reporting to ensure ongoing external input into FEMA activities.

title: Martin Luther King Jr. Federal Holiday, 2026 Proclamation
summary: A presidential proclamation issued by the President of the United States designates Martin Luther King Jr. Federal Holiday for the year 2026. The proclamation acknowledges King’s contributions to justice and civil rights and reaffirm the nation’s pledge to the principles expressed in the Declaration of Independence, emphasizing observance of the holiday and the importance of advancing equality and justice.

title: Nominations Sent to the Senate for Federal Positions including US Director of the African Development Bank and Federal Labor Relations Authority General Counsel
summary: The White House's post titled Nominations Sent to the Senate lists nominees to be submitted to the Senate for five-year terms in federal roles, including Ademola Adewale-Sadik of New York as United States Director of the African Development Bank (to succeed Oren E. Whyche-Shaw) and Charlton Allen of North Carolina as General Counsel of the Federal Labor Relations Authority (to succeed Julia Akins Clark). The post also references additional nominees such as Matthew Anderson and indicates that multiple nominations were sent to the Senate.
